To conclude We are optimistic for the future of CP within and outside China especially in the age of digital health Note we are not only focusing on China but mentioning it as one example If this model succeeds in the future more developing countries can follow 79

Last with the dramatically rapid development in AI and bigdata China has a lot to offer wrt wearable devices NLP teletherapy They are well ready to be connected with theorydriven approaches More actions are calling for researchers clinicians and policymakers 69

The solution is obvious we need more inclusive exchange amp collaboration on CP research eg alternate CP conferencesummer school in Europe North America amp China include speakers from ALL these continents in major CP conferences mindmatching and seek collaborations 59

But we argue that CP also needs China Since the emergence and development of CP CP has focused mainly on WEIRD populations Not a bad thing in itself to begin with but more diverse populations are necessary so that important findings are generalizable 49

Yet CP training is interamp multidisciplinary and is not yet part of undergraduate training To this end following the spirit of amp a few of us established the holding journal clubs hackathons unconferences and more to come 39

No doubt that China has the largest population in the world hence the largest number of ppl suffering from mental health issues The promise of both data and theorydriven CP offers insightful approaches to better understanding mental disorders So China needs CP 29

These findings together with another connectivity analysis indicate an integrated brain network supporting social influence in human decisionmaking 1215

PPI showed the putamen as the target region But what computational signal does it carry out We used the same approach for RPE and found an interesting social prediction error representation We actually encourage using this approach to justify any errorlike signals 1115

Now that we have these brain regions how do they interact Could it be possible that the brains rewardrelated regions covary with socialrelated regions For this we used simple connectivity analyses 1015

We also found the wellknown reward prediction error RPE in VSNAcc We looked into RPEs subcomponents to justify that VS is encoding RPE rather than outcome valence We recently articulated this approach in a tutorial paper 915

We observed dissociable value signals value from direct learning is only associated with vmPFC yet value from social learning is only related to ACC This is nicely compatible with a fab recent review on social learning by etal 815

Within each group we scanned one persons brain with fMRI This allowed us to measure when and where the brain carries out value computations from direct learning amp social learning and to characterize their potentially distinct neural signatures 715

So we put these elements altogether built a comprehensive model Option values were updated via both direct learning counterfactual RL amp social learning discounted cumulative reward history to guide future choices We used stan to estimate models hierarchically 615

But what are the possible computations We asked ourselves what could be the recipes for the model Importantly besides the behavior there is instantaneous social information before seeing outcome and potentially social learning after seeing outcome 515

Not surprisingly we saw that the more opposite choices the more people switched but they increased their confidence bet when seeing agreeing choices On top of previous literature it is interesting to see how group coherence playes a role here 415

We used a classic probabilistic reversal learning task but in a social context we invited 5 people each time and after each participant made their choice they could observe what the others had chosen next everyone could make adjustments followed by outcomes 315

We make decisions based on our own learning experience but also learning from others like at restaurants But how do we learn from others to better inform our own learning If they work in parallel is social learning processed differently from direct learning 215
